title: Add complete 50-place Hidden Gems India destination dataset and render full details across listing and detail pages

requirements.text: Create a single canonical frontend destinations dataset containing all 50 offbeat/hidden-gem places in India, with complete details for each place: Location, Why it’s special (significance), How to reach, Activities, Best time, and a Travel plan idea.

quotes: Add this places with complete details

acceptanceCriteria: The dataset contains exactly 50 destinations matching the user-provided list (1–50) and names/regions align with the user’s list.
Each destination entry includes: slug, name, state/region, location text, significance text, how-to-reach text (can be structured), activities list, best-time text, and travel-plan-idea text.
All user-facing strings for these details are in English.
The dataset is imported and reused wherever destination data is needed (no duplicated hardcoded destination arrays across pages).

requirements.text: Update the Destinations listing page to render all 50 destinations from the canonical dataset and ensure search/filter continues to work across the full dataset.

quotes: Ultimate List of 50 Offbeat & Hidden Gem Places in India
Add this places with complete details

acceptanceCriteria: Search matches against destination name, state/region, and short description/significance text.

Existing budget tabs continue to function; destinations that do not have explicit budget ranges in the content should still display a sensible budget label rather than breaking the UI (e.g., a default range or 'Varies').
Destination cards link correctly to /destinations/$slug for every destination in the dataset.

requirements.text: Update the Destination Detail page to load the destination based on the route slug and render the destination’s complete details sections: Location, Why it’s special (significance), How to reach, Activities, Best time, and Travel plan idea.

quotes: To keep it structured and useful... each place includes: Location, Why it’s special (Significance), How to reach, Activities, Best time, Travel plan idea

acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to /destinations/$slug renders the matching destination content from the canonical dataset (no hardcoded 'Pulga' detail).
The page visibly includes all required detail sections for each destination: Location, Significance, How to reach, Activities, Best time, and Travel plan idea.
If an unknown slug is visited, the UI shows a user-friendly 'not found' state with a link back to /destinations (no blank page or runtime error).

requirements.text: For destinations where the user supplied image URLs in the provided list, store and display at least one of those URLs per corresponding destination entry; for destinations without supplied image URLs, use the existing local fallback images.
acceptanceCriteria: Destinations with provided image URLs (e.g., Gurez Valley, Tirthan Valley, Kalpa, Chitkul, Barot Valley, Chopta, Munsiyari, Dzukou Valley, Ziro Valley, Majuli) render using those URLs at least on the destination cards and/or destination detail hero.
All destination imagery uses the existing SafeImage fallback behavior so a failed external image load degrades to the local fallback assets without broken-image icons.
No backend is introduced for image proxying; images are referenced directly by URL or via existing local assets under frontend/public.

requirements.text: Update the Home page featured destinations section to source its items from the canonical destinations dataset (and ensure featured items exist within the 50-place list).

quotes: Ultimate List of 50 Offbeat & Hidden Gem Places in India

acceptanceCriteria: Home page featured destinations are selected from the same canonical dataset used on /destinations.
Featured destination links resolve to valid /destinations/$slug routes for those featured items.
No separate hardcoded destination arrays remain on HomePage for featured destinations.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only).
Do not edit immutable paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx.
Do not add any email capture, newsletter signup, or email-based flows (explicitly out of scope per project state).
Do not introduce additional backend services; keep within the existing single-actor Motoko backend (no new backend needed for static destination content).
nonGoals: Implementing real affiliate booking, payments, or external travel APIs.
Adding user accounts beyond existing Internet Identity support.
Building an admin CMS/editor UI for managing destinations.

goalsToAdd: Publish a structured travel guide of 50 offbeat/hidden-gem places in India with complete per-place details across listing and detail views.
preferencesToAdd: Ensure destination content is in English and consistently structured (Location, Significance, How to reach, Activities, Best time, Travel plan idea).
